generated_json.title: History of Present Illness
content: The patient presents with progressive right leg weakness and anterior thigh pain, attributed to right L3-4 spinal stenosis. Symptoms began in late June 2023, with onset of pain and weakness noted around the 30th of June. The patient reports 16 falls since symptom onset, including a recent fall down the stairs. The patient has difficulty straightening the right leg, with a strength of 2/5 in the right quadriceps. Despite prior interventions, including a corticosteroid injection for suspected tendon inflammation, symptoms have not improved. The patient is unable to drive due to lack of control and requires bracing for ambulation. She relies on her husband for mobility assistance, though he is unable to walk with her. The patient has a history of breast cancer diagnosed in 2010, with recurrence in 2018 involving bone metastasis. She has been under oncologic follow-up and is currently undergoing surveillance with imaging, including a PET scan scheduled for August 24, 2023, to assess for disease progression. The patient was previously evaluated by a neurosurgeon who recommended a vertebroplasty, but this was deferred due to concurrent radiation therapy plans. The patient expresses concern about the progression of her condition and the impact on her independence and safety.

sub-section.title: Plan
content: Proceed with surgical intervention for right L3-4 spinal stenosis with decompression and stabilization.
Consider placement of vertebral body cages and pedicle screws during surgery to stabilize the spine and address osteoporotic or metastatic vertebral body instability.
Perform vertebroplasty with bone cement in the affected vertebral body if deemed appropriate during surgery.
Coordinate with oncology team regarding timing of radiation therapy and surgical intervention.
Continue current bone-modifying agent therapy for metastatic disease.
Initiate physical therapy postoperatively to improve strength and gait stability.
Provide patient education on fall prevention, home safety modifications, and use of assistive devices.
Prescribe pain management regimen as needed, including non-opioid and adjuvant analgesics.
sub-section.instruction: Detail the healthcare provider's plan of action to manage the patient's condition, specifying treatments, medications (include ongoing medications briefly), procedures, therapies, lifestyle modifications, referrals to specialists, patient education on condition and medications, and recommendations for counselings or support services.
